definition: to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Unscrew the burnt ones and replace them with the good ones.
sentences.chinese: 拿下那些燒壞了的，再換上好的。

sentences.english: 'There's a real small chance but it's still a must-win game.
sentences.chinese: 可能性確實不大，但是我們必須拿下。

sentences.english: Bynum had 18 points and 13 rebounds for Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 拜納姆拿下了18分13個籃板。

sentences.english: That the 32 points Kobe Bryant hung on them three days earlier would have been convincing enough.
sentences.chinese: 三天前拿下32分的科比已經令人心悅誠服了。

sentences.english: He was confident on their own can also win city huoshan, then ordered the attack.
sentences.chinese: 他自信靠自己的力量也能拿下霍山城，於是命令進攻。

sentences.english: Irrefutable evidence, we had the last one day every stronghold.
sentences.chinese: 鐵證如山，我方一舉拿下最後一個日僞據點。

sentences.english: Radmanovic added eight points in the third, including two 3-pointers.
sentences.chinese: 拉德馬諾維奇在第三節拿下8分，其中有兩個3分球。

sentences.english: Corey Maggette scored 23 points and Tim Thomas had 20 for the Clippers.
sentences.chinese: 馬蓋蒂，托馬斯爲快船分別拿下了23及20分。

sentences.english: Faulcon jumped up and took a pencil stub down from his shelf .
sentences.chinese: 富爾康跳了起來，從他那架子上拿下了一個鉛筆頭兒。

sentences.english: After serving out the first set, Li broke in the opening game of the second set.
sentences.chinese: 拿下第一盤之後，李娜在第二盤破發對手一個發球局。

sentences.english: Odom also had 11rebounds for his fifth consecutive double-double.
sentences.chinese: 奧多姆拿下11個籃板，連續第五個兩雙。

sentences.english: The least we can do now is win against Mainz on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們可以做的就是本週六拿下美因茨隊。

sentences.english: He took down a dictionary from the top shelf.
sentences.chinese: 他從書架頂格拿下了一本詞典。

sentences.english: What was sweeter: winning your first title or beating Liverpool in the cup final?
sentences.chinese: 拿下第一個聯賽冠軍和刷馬桶哪個更爽一點？

sentences.english: He took down a heavy brown volume from his shelves.
sentences.chinese: 他從書架上拿下一本很厚的棕色書皮的書。
我認爲他們可以拿下57勝或者58勝。

definition: person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to prevail/to achieve victory/to be victorious
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on
opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc
lit. no blood on the men's swords (idiom); fig. an effortless victory
